result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Robert Frankum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol. 
No contact with any Rock County Woodmans or Walmart.

DOC Collect.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

3:48 PM Defendant Daniel Robert Frankum in court.  Attorney Joseph Michael Freier in court for Daniel Robert Frankum.  Attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest; Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders sentence withheld, 2 years probation, DOC collect restitution of $182.00, any treatment deemed necessary, AODA, maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, may not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional, may not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol, no contact with any Rock County Woodmans or Walmart location, costs due to Clerk of Court, 0 days sentence credit.
